title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 27 September 2013 - XWiki
content:
<sdumitriu1> has quit  
07:14 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:45 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
08:07 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:25 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:29 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:30 <vmassol> mflorea: good morning  
09:30 <vmassol> did you fix the problem or just hid it? :)  
09:31 <mflorea> vmassol: good morning  
09:31 <vmassol> do you know what's the problem? because thomas has fixed it yesterday normally  
09:32 <mflorea> which problem? :)  
09:32 <vmassol> the problem was a translation resource  
09:32 <vmassol> the failing faq test  
09:32 <vmassol> yes this one is fixed but it's still failing  
09:32 <vmassol> I'm investiagting now  
09:33 <vmassol> ok so indeed the wysiwyg editor doesn't load  
09:34 <mflorea> have a little patience :)  
09:34 <vmassol> wel I've waited 30 seconds  
09:34 <vmassol> even if that's correct it's a huge bug  
09:34 <vmassol> :)  
09:34 <mflorea> I mean here, I'm going to explain  
09:34 <vmassol> ah  
09:34 <vmassol> :)  
09:34 <mflorea> :)  
09:36 <mflorea> The problem was that the WYSIWYG editor failed to load. Before, 5.2M2 the editor wasn't loaded at all (because the Velocity IF with $services.wysiwyg.isSyntaxSupported was failing silently). Now that you added the deps the script service is loaded correctly and it says yes, the syntax is supported and thus we try to load the editor but we fail because resources are missing.  
09:36 <vmassol> which resources are missing?  
09:36 <mflorea> the packager plugin specifies only the wysiwyg-server dep because it is needed in web.xml  
09:37 <mflorea> but not the resources  
09:37 <mflorea> js file  
09:37 <mflorea> which is fine  
09:37 <vmassol> the packeager is supposed to provide a wysiwyg ready XWiki instance  
09:37 <mflorea> no  
09:37 <vmassol> so we need to fix the issue  
09:37 <mflorea> it shouldn't  
09:37 <vmassol> that's what it does now  
09:37 <vmassol> )  
09:37 <vmassol> :)  
09:37 <mflorea> nop  
09:37 <vmassol> otherwise I wouldn't load any wyssiwyg stuff  
09:37 <mflorea> as I said before  
09:37 <mflorea> no  
09:37 <vmassol> marius, I coded it  
09:37 <vmassol> I know what I wanted to achieve  
09:37 <vmassol> :)  
09:38 <mflorea> let me explain please  
09:39 <mflorea> the only reason the packer plugin has a dep on WYSIWYG is because our web.xml has a filter and a servlet defined in the wysiwyg-server jar  
09:39 <mflorea> so it needs to bring the wsowyg-server to be able to deploy the webapp  
09:40 <mflorea> but it doesn't have to bring the wysowyg editor js code because wiki needs to work without the wysiwyg editor  
09:40 <vmassol> ok so let's forget what I did want to achieve in the past and focus on what we want now  
09:40 <vmassol> :)  
09:40 <vmassol> so  
09:40 <mflorea> and I just fixed macros.vm which was expecting the wysiwyg editor to be present all the time which was wring  
09:40 <mflorea> wrong  
09:40 <vmassol> if I'm in a test that needs wysiwyg what dep do I need to add?  
09:41 <vmassol> yep that's wrong indeed  
09:41 <vmassol> which ties to the discussion of yesterday with GD which we need to bring to the list I think  
09:41 <mflorea> in this \_edge\_ case you need to add a dep to the wysowyg-war as it is done in wysowyg-tests in platform  
09:41 <vmassol> it's not really edge...  
09:41 <vmassol> at all  
09:41 <vmassol> functional tests MUST do exactly as the user would see  
09:41 <vmassol> ie they should ALWAYS have the wysiwyg  
09:42 <vmassol> except for some edge cases  
09:42 <mflorea> that's the role of the wysowyg tests  
09:42 <vmassol> when we want to test the special case when the user has disabled the wysiwyg  
09:42 <mflorea> you don't test the editor  
09:42 <vmassol> (which never happens)  
09:42 <vmassol> this is NOT the point  
09:42 <vmassol> these are \*\*functional\*\* tests  
09:42 <vmassol> they MUST  
09:42 <vmassol> no  
09:42 <vmassol> \*\*MUST\*\*  
09:42 <vmassol> :)  
09:42 <vmassol> be with the same environment as the user  
09:42 <vmassol> if we want to be sure they work  
09:42 <vmassol> now  
09:43 <vmassol> do we think this has a cost?  
09:43 <vmassol> enough to justify not having it  
09:43 <vmassol> for unit tests I prefectly agree with you  
09:43 <vmassol> OR  
09:43 <vmassol> we consider those integration tests and we still need additional functional tests  
09:43 <vmassol> let me give you one example  
09:44 <vmassol> imagine that the FAQ app is forcing the wiki editor (but it doesn't do it voluntrarily)  
09:44 <vmassol> the tests will pass  
09:44 <vmassol> but when the user uses the FAQ app  
09:44 <vmassol> he'll get the wiki editor  
09:44 <mflorea> vincent, I understand all you are saying  
09:44 <vmassol> whereas he'd expect the wysiwyg one  
09:44 <vmassol> but we wouldn't have noticed it  
09:45 <mflorea> in this case you write a test  for it!  
09:45 <mflorea> it different  
09:45 <vmassol> you cannot think about that  
09:45 <vmassol> it's just too hard  
09:45 <vmassol> in this case you write  
09:45 <vmassol> a test  
09:45 <vmassol> to verify you have the top level menu too  
09:45 <vmassol> and multiply this by 100 to verify everything  
09:46 <vmassol> while here in the the current FAQ test  
09:46 <tmortagne> vmassol: what you are saying about the WYSIWYG is the opposite of what we do when creating a minimal runtime with only what the application need to work, nobody ever do that  
09:46 <tmortagne> if we follow 100% what your are saying we move back all those tests to XE  
09:46 <vmassol> no because  
09:46 <vmassol> the FAQ doesn't interact with a lot of other apps/modules  
09:46 <vmassol> so we don't need those  
09:46 <mflorea> I'm just going to say that for me the FAQ has nothing to do with the WYSIWYG editor and thus it shouldn't have to require it  
09:46 <vmassol> but it does interact with the WYSIWYG  
09:46 <vmassol> (as almost all apps)  
09:46 <mflorea> if you want it then add the dep on wysowyg war on faw tests  
09:47 <vmassol> wich is why I was asking which dep we need to add in the func test to add the wysiwyg if we don't put it by defaukt  
09:47 <tmortagne> if a application require the WYSIWYG then that application should depend on it but the WYSIWYG should not be in the default package  
09:47 <mflorea> I definitely agree with thomas  
09:47 <vmassol> tmortagne: with this reasoning the packager plugin's pom.xml should be empty  
09:47 <tmortagne> now it's a pity that an application really require the WYSIWYG  
09:48 <vmassol> it's not that it requires it  
09:48 <vmassol> it's just that it should work with and without it  
09:48 <mflorea> there's no app that requires the wysiwyg editor!  
09:48 <vmassol> and it's much better to test with it  
09:48 <vmassol> than without  
09:48 <vmassol> becauase that's what the user will use  
09:48 <vmassol> and again the goal of a functional test is to verify that what the user will do will work  
09:49 <tmortagne> vmassol: well yes the packager plugin pom.xml should be empty ideally since the goal is to test with only what is needed by the application, if the application does not need something I don't really see why we put it in the package  
09:49 <vmassol> tmortagne: I agree except if it makes writing func tests too hard  
09:49 <vmassol> so we jsut should be careful it stays reasonable  
09:49 <vmassol> but yes with flavors it'll be better  
09:50 <vmassol> because the func testw ill be able to depend on a "base" flavor  
09:50 <vmassol> mflorea: what dep do I nee to add?  
09:50 <vmassol> the wysiwyg war?  
09:50 <mflorea> I believe I said it twice :)  
09:50 <vmassol> ah yes I missed the "war" part  
09:50 <vmassol> :)  
09:50 <tmortagne> flavors won't change anything to these tests, you can still declare all the dependencies you need in an application and depending on a flavor in an application is very wrong for me  
09:50 <vmassol> sorry  
09:51 <vmassol> tmortagne: I strongly disagree  
09:51 <vmassol> because I'm not going to add 100 deps in every func test  
09:51 <vmassol> that's bad  
09:51 <mflorea> vmassol: check xwiki-platform-wysiwyg-tests  
09:51 <vmassol> anyway I think we all agree in the end  
09:52 <tmortagne> you don't need 100 deps  
09:52 <vmassol> mflorea: did oyu change the FAQ test code?  
09:52 <mflorea> no, why?  
09:52 <vmassol> I'm surpsied it works the same with and withjout the wysiwyg editor  
09:53 <mflorea> the test was written to work with no WYSIWYG :)  
09:53 <vmassol> not really  
09:53 <vmassol> I wrote it  
09:53 <vmassol> and I didn't think about this  
09:53 <vmassol> :)  
09:53 <vmassol> it's luck  
09:53 <vmassol> ;)  
09:53 <vmassol> but good  
09:53 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
09:53 <mflorea> the way you set the answer content is made to work with plain text area  
09:54 <vmassol> what happened I think is just that the wysiwyg wasn't loading  
09:54 <vmassol> and I coded the tets to work with the wiki editor  
09:54 <mflorea> yes, and I said this above  
09:54 <vmassol> now I've never tried this app on a full XE  
09:55 <vmassol> I've only tested it on xwiki.org but I don't have the wysiwyg editor there either  
09:55 <mflorea> again, the application has nothing to do with the wysiwyg editor  
09:56 <vmassol> because my user has plain text forced  on xwiki.org  
09:56 <vmassol> (text)  
09:56 <mflorea> the application doesn't even know there is a wysiwyg editor  
09:56 <mflorea> and this is true for almost all applications  
09:57 <mflorea> normally  
09:57 <vmassol> can you tell me we need wysiwyg client in packager plugin?  
09:57 <mflorea> applications just display their fields in a form and xwiki takes care of loading the wysiwyg editor  
09:57 <mflorea> wysiwyg-server depends on wysiwyg-client  
09:58 <mflorea> (for the service interfaces)  
09:58 <vmassol> ok I have to go for the roadmap meeting  
09:58 <vmassol> could you document the deps on wysiwyg in the pom marius to explain why there's there?  
09:58 <vmassol> \*they're there  
09:58 <mflorea> isn't this already documented?  
09:58 <vmassol> and verify we only have the minimal deps for wysiwyg (nothing extra that we could drop)  
09:58 <vmassol> nope  
09:59 <vmassol> thanks  
09:59 <mflorea> ok  
09:59 <fmancinelli> has quit  
10:15 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:31 <fmancinelli> has quit  
10:38 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
11:02 <UCC> has joined #xwiki  
11:04 <sburjan> vmassol: good morning. do you remember at which version of XWiki we put in the RN that you have to delete the old index dir because SOLR was getting stuck at indexing ?  
11:05 <sburjan> I clearly remember reporting this on IRC, but I can't find it in the RN  
11:05 <vmassol> sburjan: don't know probably in some 5.0 RN  
11:05 <sburjan> that's where I am looking  
11:25 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
11:27 <mflorea> has quit  
11:32 <Denis> has quit  
12:00 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:40 <Slashman> has quit  
12:42 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:52 <mflorea1> [all] hold your commits for a few hours because I'd like to start the release after the current CI jobs finish successfully.  
14:08 <sdumitriu> has quit  
14:09 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
14:45 <mflorea1> has quit  
14:59 <sdumitriu> has quit  
15:01 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
15:36 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
15:55 <vmassol> @all: should I ban Richard Kulisz or do still want to have fun with him?  
15:56 <vmassol> evalica: any opinion? :)  
15:57 <evalica> vmassol: I've also received private mails from him - those are much nicer than the one's from the mailinglist  
15:57 <evalica> I don't care as long as it's interventions are targeted to a limited number of threads  
15:57 <vmassol> I don't really like accepting profanity on the ist  
15:57 <evalica> \*its  
15:57 <vmassol> \*list  
15:58 <vmassol> mflorea, tmortagne, sburjan, cjd, sdumitriu, fmancinelli: any opinion?  
15:58 <sdumitriu> vmassol: +1  
15:59 <vmassol> (msmeria too)  
15:59 <sburjan> it seems that cjd understood what he wants, I didn't quite get it.  
16:00 <vmassol> :)  
16:00 <vmassol> the problem is not what he wants, it might even be interesting  
16:00 <vmassol> the problme is in how he discussed  
16:01 <sburjan> his analogy was somehow funny (even if I didn't understood it) .. and the harsh language .. I don't quite approve for, not in an open list  
16:01 <mflorea> vmassol: -0, I think it's best to simply ignore him. I didn't see any "profanity" in his mails, just some strong language  
16:01 <vmassol> I'd agree mflorea except for the profanity  
16:01 <vmassol> really?  
16:01 <vmassol> calling people: fuck, imbeciles, morons  
16:01 <sburjan> let's see what he answers to cjd first  
16:01 <vmassol> you don't call that profanity?  
16:02 <vmassol> and I'm not even listing the other things  :)  
16:02 <mflorea> vmassol: that was a reply. Just don't reply to him.  
16:03 <vmassol> ok I'll wait for replies from him  
16:03 <vmassol> next time he says something not nice I'm banning him  
16:03 <msmeria> vmassol: I agree to baning him. Someone that talks like that doesn't deserve a second chance  
16:03 <vmassol> tmortagne: ?  
16:04 <tmortagne> -0 too, lets just ignore him  
16:04 <tmortagne> it's not like it was spam on a number of threads  
16:04 <mflorea> exactly  
16:04 <mflorea> just one thread  
16:04 <tmortagne> not even sure we will see more mails from him anyway  
16:04 <fmancinelli> well, it would help if Guillaume stops to feed the troll :)  
16:05 <tmortagne> yes  
16:05 <tmortagne> it does not really help much  
16:05 <vmassol> OTOH it would be nice to have more replies from him to laugh at it in few years when we look back at the archives :)  
16:06 <vmassol> the guy is seriously ill  
16:07 <vmassol> hmm he has some racist comments too, that's also bad  
16:07 <vmassol> I don't think we can ignore that TBH  
16:08 <vmassol> "and \*you\* get to pretend the whole world is filled to the brim by eager beavers gleefully singing kumbaya like happy fucking niggers."  
16:11 <vmassol> ok one more reply from him that contains anything personal aimed at someone and I'm banning him  
16:11 <vmassol> are we ok with that?  
16:13 <msmeria> +1  
16:13 <msmeria> has quit  
16:14 <mflorea> I keep my -0, don't feed the troll, just ignore him  
16:14 <vmassol> the troll isn't an issue  
16:14 <vmassol> the issue are the racist comments and the personal attacks  
16:26 <fmancinelli> I tend to agree with Marius. Let's try to ignore him - this should stop his stream of messages. If it doesn't so let's put him in the black list.  
16:28 <UCC> has quit  
16:45 <UCC> has joined #xwiki  
16:47 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
16:48 <sburjan> has quit

16:52 <vmassol> mflorea: I think you should send an email to propose a new release date for 5.2 final. IMO next Wednesday WDYT? (we need to not postpone too much since that means less time for 5.3, 5.4 and 5.5)  
16:52 <Enygma`> has quit  
16:52 <mflorea> next Wednesday sounds good, I'll send a mail asap  
16:53 <vmassol> ok  
17:20 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
17:35 <sburjan`> @devs, could put someone fixFor to 5.2 on this one ? http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9515 Thanks !  
17:43 <vmassol> sburjan`: done  
17:43 <vmassol> I've pinged guillaume but he's not working today  
17:43 <mflorea> has quit  
17:51 <vmassol> just realized that with the dates I've proposed XWiki 5.3 final will be for Christmas :)  
18:13 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:16 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
18:19 <fmancinelli> has quit  
18:54 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
19:00 <UCC> has quit  
19:27 <Slashman> has quit  
19:33 <mflorea> vmassol: help  
19:33 <vmassol> I have to go in 2 miutes, hope I can help within that time :)  
19:33 <mflorea> it's quick  
19:33 <mflorea> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/2fc36e8f8cc0592c646ae99c098cd352aed23152  
19:34 <mflorea> which markdown syntax should we have in enterprise now?  
19:34 <mflorea> I see markdown1 and 2 in rendering  
19:34 <vmassol> both no?  
19:34 <vmassol> ATM we bundle all syntaxes  
19:34 <vmassol> so I propose to not change that for 5.2  
19:34 <vmassol> and we can discuss it later on  
19:34 <mflorea> ok, I'll update the pom  
19:34 <vmassol> thanks  
19:35 <vmassol> I forgot about that indeed  
19:35 <mflorea> it fails on release  
19:35 <mflorea> I'll fix it  
19:36 <UCC> has joined #xwiki  
19:36 <mflorea> thanks
